p:
Placental infection with COVID‐19 may be the critical factor that may lead to pregnancy complications. Although few, new reports have shown the presence of SARS‐CoV‐2 within the placenta correlating with pregnancy complications such as miscarriage and pre‐eclampsia.
34 Hosier et al reported a case of second trimester pregnancy with symptomatic COVID‐19 complicated by pre‐eclampsia and placental abruption. When they analyze the placenta they found the presence of SARS‐CoV‐2 localized predominantly to syncytiotrophoblast cells at the maternal‐fetal interface of the placenta.
35
